projects.name: 3.1.14 UNICEF: Strengthen the preparedness and response capacity of the country to humanitarian situations
projects.description: In 2025, UNICEF helped protect children across Mongolia from growing health and climate emergencies by acting earlier and strengthening essential services. projects.name: 1.4.5 Advocacy for access to indoor toilet facilities by pregnant and postpartum women in 20 soums of 10 selected provinces
projects.description: UNFPA will provide focused assistance to 20 soums in sexual reproductive health. UNFPA will advocate the local governments to improve water and sanitation at these selected soum health centers during the monitoring missions and annual review meetings, so pregnant and postpartum women have access to indoor toilet facilities.
projects.outcome: Output 1.4 - The capacities are in place to deliver universal, affordable and quality water supply, sanitation and hygiene (WASH) services that is climate-resilient and gender-responsive

projects.name: 1.1.6 Health of women, adolescents and youth in Umnugobi province is improved through provision of health care services to the population of Umnugovi aimag, especially target groups.
projects.description: Health of women, adolescents and youth in Umnugobi province is improved through provision of health care services to the population of Umnugovi aimag, especially target groups including mother, children, adolescents, young, people with disabilities, mobile population. Key interventions include:  a) the prevention of any diseases based on their needs, b) the introduction of new evidence-based diagnostic and treatment technologies, and c) the establishment of an appropriate health financing system
projects.outcome: Output 1.1 -The capacities are in place to promote integrated healthcare system to deliver universal, affordable and quality healthcare (physical, mental, sexual and reproductive), including nutrition

projects.name: 2.1.11 Increased access to care and services for people with disabilities in Umnugovi aimag to create an environment for the transition of the population and target groups from welfare to employment
projects.description: Increased access to care and services for people with disabilities in Umnugovi aimag to create an environment for the transition of the population and target groups from welfare to employment

projects.name: 4.1.6 Monitoring the implementation of rights to SRH for vulnerable population groups
projects.description: Strengthening the capacity of the National Human Rights Commission of Mongolia, civil society organizations, and the private sector to protect, promote and monitor human rights (esp. gender equality) of all.

projects.name: 2.3.6 Promoting Clean Technology Innovation and Entrepreneurship for Green Jobs
projects.description: Support low-carbon economic growth by promoting clean technology innovations and entrepreneurship through a Cleantech innovation platform and accelerator programme
projects.outcome: Output 2.3 - Government has the capacity to create transparent and predictable investment climate, innovative financing for the private investment in resource efficient and low-carbon development, and

projects.name: 1.6.2 Support the Ministry of Justice and CSOs with technical assistance and research to develop and implement effective policy and inclusive strategies on countering violence against women
